column4: Hello, I am having a problem with GNOME in Ubuntu 9.10. Basically, I accidentally dragged about a few hundred emails from thundebird to my panel, and I need a quick way to close them. I tried restarting the computer, but they are still there.
select all of them and delete 'em
Control-A to select all, del to delete
I'm not sure how to do it. I clicked the taskbar and then did the control+a combo and then pressed the delete key and nothing happened.
click the desktop and click control-a
Won't that delete all of my desktop icons?  I am trying to get rid of all of these panel icons.
you dragged the messages on to the panel or desktop?
so what is coming on the panel?
wait a minute I will drag a message on the panel and see for myself
when I click one, I get an error message saying the "location is not supported"
the only solution would be to remove these icons one by one
Man, that is going to take forever!
never forget that determined people can do stuff in seconds
Could there be something in gconf-editor that would let me edit my panel shotcuts?
